greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1; thereafter a(n) is obtained by applying Eric Angelini's remove-repeated-digits map, x->A320486(x), to n*a(n-1), stopping when 0 is reached.
reference: Eric Angelini, Posting to Sequence Fans Mailing List, Oct 24 2018
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Coordination Sequences, Planing Numbers, and Other Recent Sequences (II), Experimental Mathematics Seminar, Rutgers University, Jan 31 2019, Part I, Part 2, Slides. (Mentions this sequence)
example: a(6)=720, so for a(7) we compute 7*720 = 5040 which becomes 54 = a(7).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 03 2018
